be.adaxisoft.flat

Class Flat

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.adaxisoft.flat.Flat

  • public class Flat
extends Object
    This library flattens JSON files.

    Before:
    {
        "key1": {
                "keyA": "valueI"
        },
        "key2": {
                "keyB": "valueII"
        },
        "key3": { "a": { "b": { "c": 2 } } }
}
    After:
    {
        "key1.keyA": "valueI",
        "key2.keyB": "valueII",
        "key3.a.b.c": 2
}
    The library can do the reverse operation as well: unflatten.
    Author:
    GÃ©rik Bonaert

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_DELIMITER

        public static final String DEFAULT_DELIMITER
        The default delimiter is used by methods that do not specify a delimiter. The default value of the delimiter is '.' (dot).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • flatten

        public static String flatten(org.json.JSONObject jsonObject)
                      throws org.json.JSONException
        This method flattens the given JSON object. It will use the default delimiter. Your keys cannot contain the default delimiter.
        Parameters:
        jsonObject - the JSON object to flatten
        Returns:
        a string representation of the flattened JSON document.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException

      • flatten

        public static String flatten(String jsonString)
                      throws org.json.JSONException
        This method flattens the string representation of the JSON object. It will use the default delimiter. Your keys cannot contain the default delimiter.
        Parameters:
        jsonString - the string representation of the JSON object.
        Returns:
        a string representation of the flattened JSON document.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - when the given string cannot be parsed to a JSON object.

      • flatten

        public static String flatten(org.json.JSONObject jsonObject,
             String delimiter)
                      throws org.json.JSONException
        This method flattens the given JSON object. It will use the given delimiter to separate keys and indexes. Your keys cannot contain the given delimiter.
        Running the following code: 
         Flat.flatten(new JSONObject("\"key1": { \"nested1\" : 1, \"nested2\" : 2 }}"), "@");
        will generate: 
         {
        "key1@nested1" : 1
        "key1@nested2" : 2
 }
        instead of the default:
         {
        "key1.nested1" : 1
        "key1.nested2" : 2
 }
        Parameters:
        jsonObject - the JSON object to flatten
        delimiter - the delimiter to use when joining the keys.
        Returns:
        a string representation of the flattened JSON document.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException

      • flatten

        public static String flatten(String jsonString,
             String delimiter)
                      throws org.json.JSONException
        This method flattens the string representation of the JSON object. It will use the given delimiter to separate keys and indexes. Your keys cannot contain the given delimiter.
        Running the following code: 
                Flat.flatten("\"key1": { \"nested1\" : 1, \"nested2\" : 2 }}", "@");
        will generate: 
         {
        "key1@nested1" : 1
        "key1@nested2" : 2
 }
        instead of the default:
         {
        "key1.nested1" : 1
        "key1.nested2" : 2
 }
        Parameters:
        jsonString - the string representation of the JSON object.
        delimiter - the delimiter to use when joining the keys.
        Returns:
        a string representation of the flattened JSON document.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - when the given string cannot be parsed to a JSON object.

      • unflatten

        public static String unflatten(String flatJsonString)
                        throws org.json.JSONException
        This method takes the string representation of a flattened JSON object and returns it to the conventional format. It will use the default delimiter.
        Parameters:
        flatJsonString - the string representation of the JSON object.
        Returns:
        a string representation of a conventional JSON object.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - when the given string cannot be parsed to a JSON object.
